metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3154 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in Zend\Mail (Zend_Mail) in Zend Frameworkbefore 1.12.12, 2.x before 2.3.8, and 2.4.x before 2.4.1 allows remoteattackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP responsesplitting attacks via CRLF sequences in the header of an email.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzend-framework-php - 1.12.20+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zend-framework - 1.12.20+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zend-framework-bin - 1.12.20+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zendframework - 1.12.20+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zendframework-bin - 1.12.20+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zendframework-resources - 1.12.20+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zendframework package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.20+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
